revised_title: Investigation of Ultra-Violet Ray Absorption by Various Substances
tldr: This study examines the absorption of ultra-violet rays by various substances, including chlorine, bromine, iodine, and other chemical compounds. The authors use a spark of an induction coil as the light source and analyze the absorption through spectroscopy. The results show the different absorption patterns and limits for each substance, providing insights into their chemical properties and potential applications.
